article: This story happened when I was 11 years old. I'll never forget it. I was at my friend Jenny's  _  after school one day. We were doing homework when a friend of Jenny's mum's came over to  _  . I don't remember her name or even what she looked like. I  _  remember her hands, her voice and the lesson she taught me. I remember her hand reaching out for mine. What  _  hands she had, I thought; rich, dark skin going well with the orange nail polish . Then I heard her saying, "Oh no, that is NOT  _  you shake hands. Let me show you." After that, I just remember her voice explaining the importance of a good  _  , having a sense of self, looking the other person in the eye... At that moment I felt respected. I think of her every time I meet someone  _  . I'm so thankful for her little lesson. I thank her for  _  the time to teach me something I didn't know. I thank her for the  _  that she didn't talk down to me because I was 11 or because I didn't  _  something. I thank her for instilling the idea that if someone doesn't know something, don't be afraid to share your knowledge.
